Fabrice (Matondo) Sewolo is a public health professional with expertise in epidemiology. He has extensive experience in the health field, having worked as a medical analyst, consulting epidemiologist, and technical expert.
Sewolo holds a Master's degree in Intervention Epidemiology from the Kinshasa School of Public Health and a medical degree from the University of Lubumbashi.
He is passionate about using data analysis and biostatistics to improve public health and has worked on several initiatives aimed at eradicating diseases such as dracunculiasis , measles, poliomyelitis and other vaccine-preventable diseases.
He remains open to new opportunities and is enthusiastic about contributing to initiatives that improve the health and well-being of communities.
